tuv.seg: Finding a job in Ireland
Post a fháil in Éirinn
If you are moving to Ireland or considering re-locating here, finding a job is probably going to be one of your priorities
Má tá tú ag bogadh go hÉirinn nó má tá tú ag machnamh faoi athlonnú abhus, is dócha gur ceann amháin de do chuid tosaíochtaí é post a fháil
It is advisable to have employment and possibly some accommodation organised in advance of your journey but it is not a requirement
Moltar duit an fhostaíocht agus lóistín éigin, más féidir, a bheith eagraithe agat roimh d'aistear ach ní riachtanas é seo

If you are planning to move country, it makes sense to do some research into the opportunities available here, the average rates of pay and taxation issues and to ensure there are no restrictions that would preclude you from working here

Má tá tú ag pleanáil le bogadh tíre, luíonn sé le réasún go ndéanfá roinnt taighde faoi na deiseanna atá ar fáil anseo, faoi na meán-rátaí pá agus faoi shaincheisteanna cánachais agus go gcinnteofá nach bhfuil aon srianta ann a chuirfeadh cosc ort óna dhul ag obair sa tír seo
The Citizens Information website does not carry any information about job vacancies for any sector of the Irish economy
Ní bhíonn aon eolas faoi fholúntais d'earnáil ar bith den gheilleagar Éireannach ag CitizensInformation.ie
It does not accept CVs/resumes and cannot forward them to employers on your behalf
Ní ghlacann CitizensInformation.ie le Curricula Vitae/dintiúir agus ní féidir iad a chur ar aghaidh chuig fostóirí ar do shonsa
Recruitment agencies in Ireland offer a wide range of employment opportunities - from casual employment to specialised skills - see 'Where to apply' below
Tá raon leathan d'áisíneachtaí earcaíochta in Éirinn a sholáthraíonn eolas faoi phoist in Éirinn (féach 'Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas' thíos)
This document will provide you with information and advice about coming to work in Ireland and your rights when finding and securing a job as a foreign national employee in Ireland
Tabharfaidh an cháipéis seo eolas agus comhairle duit faoi teacht chun bheith ag obair in Éirinn agus do chearta má tá tú ag lorg agus ag fáil poist mar fhostaí náisiúnach eachtrach in Éirinn
Quality and Qualifications Ireland is the Irish centre for the recognition of international qualifications
Is é Dearbhú Cáilíochta agus Cáilíochtaí Éireann an t-ionad Éireannach a aithníonn cáilíochtaí idirnáisiúnta
It has an International Qualifications Database
Tá Bunachar Sonraí Cáilíochtaí Idirnáisiúnta aige
You need to know about how qualifications are recognised in Ireland and about the mutual recognition of professional qualifications
Caithfidh tú eolas a bheith agat ar an dóigh a aithnítear cáilíochtaí in Éirinn agus faoi comhaitheantas cáilíochtaí gairmiúla

If you have a professional qualification, you should check with the Irish branch of your professional body as to whether your qualifications are acceptable for use in Ireland - see 'Professions and careers' below

Má tá cáilíocht phroifisiúnta agat, ba cheart duit seiceáil leis an gcraobh Éireannach de do chomhlacht gairmiúil lena fháil amach an bhfuil do cháilíochtaí inghlactha le húsáid in Éirinn – féach 'Gairmeacha' thíos
If you are an EEA or Swiss national coming to work in Ireland, you are entitled to be treated like any other applicant when you apply for work
Más saoránach LEE nó Eilvéiseach thú ag teacht chun bheith ag obair in Éirinn, tá tú i dteideal go ndéileáfar leat cosúil le hiarrthóir ar bith eile nuair a chuireann tú iarratas isteach ar obair
You are free to apply for any job vacancy, including jobs in the public sector
Tá cead agat cur isteach ar aon fholúntas oibre, lena n-áirítear poist san earnáil phoiblí
These include jobs in the Irish army and the Irish police force (An Garda Síochána), but not the Irish diplomatic service
Cuimsíonn siad seo poist in Óglaigh na hÉireann agus i bhfórsa póilíneachta na hÉireann (An Garda Síochána), ach ní le seirbhís taidhleoireachta na hÉireann
Note: the EEA (European Economic Area) comprises the European Union (EU) member states, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein
Nóta: is é atá san LEE (EEA i mBéarla) ná ballstáit an AE, an Iorua, an Íoslainn agus Lichtinstéin
European Employment Services (EURES)
Seirbhísí Fostaíochta Eorpacha (EURES)
Citizens of the EU/EEA are free to live and work in other member states without restriction
Tá an tsaoirse ag saoránaigh de chuid an AE/LEE chun cónaí agus obair i mBallstáit eile gan srianadh
To facilitate the free movement of workers between member states, the EURES network consisting of the public employment service and the European Commission in each country has been established
Chun saorghluaiseacht oibrithe idir ballstáit a éascú, bunaíodh líonra i ngach tír arb í an tseirbhís fostaíochta phoiblí agus an Coimisiún Eorpach atá inti
• Provide a European Job Placement Services for jobseekers
• Seirbhís Socrúcháin i bPoist Eorpacha a sholáthar do dhaoine a bhíonn ag lorg post
• Offer advice and guidance on how to look for a job in the EEA and the possibilities that exist for finding work in another country
• Seirbhís earcaíochta a sholáthar d'fhostóirí ar mian leo dul i mbun earcaíochta sna Ballstáit LEE
• Provide a recruitment service to employers who wish to recruit in EEA member states
• Eolas faoi choinníollacha cónaithe agus oibre sna Ballstáit de chuid an LEE a sholáthar
• Provide information on living and working conditions in EEA member states
• Seirbhís earcaíochta a sholáthar d'fhostóirí ar mian leo dul i mbun earcaíochta sna Ballstáit LEE
Within each EU/EEA member state, specially trained placement officers (called EURES Advisers) provide free information and advice to workers and employers about all of the above issues

Laistigh de gach Ballstát de chuid an AE/LEE, soláthraíonn Oifigigh Socrúcháin (dá ngairtear comhairleoirí EURES) ar oiliúnaithe go speisialta iad eolas agus comhairle shaor in aisce d'oibrithe agus d'fhostóirí faoi gach ceann de na saincheisteanna thuas
EEA jobseekers who wish to work in another member state will obtain information on jobs and information on living/working conditions in the EEA here
Gheobhaidh na daoine a bhíonn ag lorg post agus gur ón AE/LEE iad, agus ar mian leo obair i mBallstát eile eolas ar phoist agus eolas ar choinníollacha cónaithe/oibre san LEE anseo
If you are looking for work, you can also post your CV on the EURES website where it can be accessed by thousands of employers throughout the EEA
Má tá tú ag lorg oibre, féadfaidh tú do Churriculum Vitae a chur ar shuíomh gréasáin EURES, áit ar féidir leis na mílte fostóirí ó fud an LEE é a shroichint
This will help maximise your chances of securing employment
Tabharfaidh sé seo an seans is fearr duit chun fostaíocht a fháil
In general non-EEA nationals (apart from some exceptions) must have a employment permit to work in Ireland
Go ginearálta ní mór do shaoránaigh neamh-LEE (ach amháin eisceachtaí) cead fostaíochta a bheith acu le bheith ag obair in Éirinn
From 12 October 2007 non-EEA nationals who are carrying out scientific research for approved research organisations do not need an employment permit
Ón 18 Deireadh Fomhair 2007 má bíonn náisiúnaigh neamh-LEE ag déanamh taighde eolaíoch le eagraíochtaí eolaíocha ceadaithe, ní bheidh cead fostaíochta uirthi
The arrangements for employment permits include:
Beidh na rudaí seo a leanas ar na socruithe do cheadanna fostaíochta:
• Critical Skills Employment Permits which are available for all occupations with an annual salary above €60,000 and for a restricted range of occupations with an annual salary above €30,000
• Cead Fostaíochta Scileanna Ríthábhachtacha atá ar fáil do gach post a bhfuil tuarastal bliantúil ag dul leis os cionn €60,000 agus do réimse teoranta post le tuarastal bliantúil os cionn €30,000
• General Employment Permits which are available mainly for occupations with salaries between €30,000 and €60,000 which are not eligible for a Critical Skills Employment Permit
• Cead Fostaíochta Ginearálta atá ar fáil go príomha do phoist a bhfuil tuarastal idir €30,000 agus €60,000 acu agus nach bhfuil incháilithe do Chead Fostaíochta Scileanna Ríthábhactacha
The General Employment Permit application must meet a labour market test showing that the position could not be filled from within the EEA
Caithfidh an t-iarratas ar Chead Fostaíochta Ginearálta tástáil an mhargaidh shaothair a chomhlíonadh ag léiriú nach bhféadfaí an folúntas a líonadh ó laistigh den LEE
Your nearest Irish embassy or consulate will be able to advise on whether you require a travel visa before coming to Ireland
Beidh an ambasáid nó an chonsalacht Éireannach is cóngaraí duit in ann comhairliú duit an mbeidh víosa de dhíth ort sula dtagann tú go hÉirinn nó nach mbeidh
These jobs are often advertised in shop windows, in shopping centres, through daily Irish newspapers and through employment agencies
Is minic na poist seo á bhfógairt i bhfuinneoga siopaí, in ionaid siopadóireachta, trí na páipéir nuachtáin laethúla Éireannacha agus trí áisíneachtaí earcaíochta

While many of these jobs do not require any specific professional qualifications, it is advisable to bring evidence of any educational standards (such as secondary school certificates, diplomas, and degrees) you have attained with you to Ireland

Cé nach mbíonn aon cháilíochtaí gairmiúla de dhíth ar go leor de na poist sin, moltar duit fianaise um chaighdeáin oideachasúla ar bith a ghnóthaigh tú (.i. teastais iar-bhunscoileanna, dioplómaí, céimeanna, srl.) a thabhairt leat go hÉirinn
It is also useful to bring an up-to-date résumé/CV in the English language with you as you may be requested to supply information on any experience or expertise you may have
B'áisiúil an ní é freisin dá dtabharfá CV/dintiúir sa Bhéarla ar suas chun dáta iad leat, óir gur dócha go n-iarrfaí ort eolas a sholáthar ar aon taithí nó aon saineolas a bheadh agat
If you are planning to come to Ireland and are seeking casual employment, you could register with a recruitment agency in advance of your journey
Má tá tú ag pleanáil chun teacht go hÉirinn agus go bhfuil tú ag féachaint le corr-fhostaíocht a fháil, d’fhéadfá clárú le háisíneacht earcaíochta roimh d’aistear abhus
You should also keep an eye on advertisements for casual workers in shops/stores
Ba chóir duit súil a choinneáil amach freisin ar fhógraí do chorr-oibrithe sna siopaí féin
Finding a career job in Ireland will involve a little more planning than looking for casual work
Beidh níos mó pleanála ag teastáil chun post gairmiúil a fháil in Éirinn ná mar a bheidh i gcás corr-oibre
While a career job may take a little longer to secure, you are advised get organised and start applying for jobs before you travel
Cé go dtógfadh post gairmiúil píosa breise ama lena fháil, moltar duit tú féin a eagrú agus chun tosú ag cur isteach ar phoist sula dtaistilíonn tú
It is also useful to bear in mind that these jobs are generally paid at a higher level than other jobs that do not require any qualifications
B'áisiúil duit freisin a mheabhrú go n-íoctar tuarastail ar leibhéal níos airde sna poist seo thairis poist eile nach dteastaíonn aon cháilíochtaí dóibh
Almost all professions in Ireland have associations or societies in Ireland that represent and often regulate their members
Tá cumainn nó comhaltais in Éirinn ag nach mór gach uile ghairm in Éirinn a dhéanann ionadaíocht dá gcuid ball agus ar minic go rialaíonn siad iad freisin
These associations will provide information on recognition of professional qualifications, employment opportunities and careers
Soláthróidh na cumainn sin eolas um aithint cháilíochtaí gairmiúla, um dheiseanna fostaíochta agus um ghairmeacha
Almost all of these organisations have their own websites (pdf), which you can search for online using any good search engine
Tá a chuid láithreán gréasáin féin ag nach mór gach aon cheann de na heagrais seo (pdf), ar féidir leat cuardach ina leith ar líne ag baint leasa as aon inneall cuardaigh ar fios a ghnóithe dó
All employees, irrespective of their nationality, experience, expertise or profession, are protected by the law in Ireland
Tugtar cosaint do gach fostaí in Éirinn - beag beann ar a náisiúntacht, a dtaithí, a saineolas nó a ngairm – faoin dlí in Éirinn
These laws set down specific rules about minimum rates of pay, working hours, leave, health and safety, changing jobs and employment rights
Leagann na dlithe seo síos rialacha sonracha faoi íosrátaí pá, faoi uaireanta oibre, faoi shaoire, faoin tsláinte agus an tsábháilteacht, faoi phoist a athrú agus faoi chearta fostaíochta
For commercial reasons, it is not possible for the Citizens Information website to carry information about actual job vacancies, specific employment opportunities or information on careers in Ireland

De bharr chúiseanna tráchtála, ní féidir le CitizensInformation.ie eolas a thaispeáint faoi fholúntais do phoist atá ar fáil, ná faoi dheiseanna fostaíochta faoi leith ná eolas ar ghairmeacha in Éirinn
The Citizens Information website cannot accept résumés/CVs or provide information on specific career paths
Ní féidir le CitizensInformation.ie glacadh le dintiúir/ le Curricula Vitae ná eolas a sholáthar um bealaí gairmréime faoi leith
If you are applying for a job in Ireland through a recruitment agency, it's worth bearing in mind that it is very unusual that you are charged for these services
Is é an gnáthnós é d'áisíneachtaí earcaíochta in Éirinn táille a ghearradh ar dhaoine dá gcuid seirbhísí
When you apply for a job you need to have a curriculum vitae (CV) or resumé in English which is a summary or listing of your qualifications and work experience
Nuair a dhéanann tú iarratas ar phost ní mór duit curriculum vitae (CV) a bheith agat i mBéarla ar achoimre é nó liosta de do cháilíochtaí agus do thaithí oibre
You also should have original copies of your qualifications and official copies of them in English
Ba chóir duit bunchóipeanna de do cháilíochtaí agus cóipeanna oifigiúla díobh i mBéarla a bheith agat chomh maith
If you are in Ireland and you need to have documents translated into English you can contact the embassy or consulate of your country for assistance
Má tá tú in Éirinn agus gur gá duit cáipéisí a bheith aistrithe go Béarla, is féidir leat dul i dteagmháil le hambasáid nó consalacht na tíre chun cabhair a fháil
Qualifications recognition: you can download a comparability statement for your qualification and a user guide (pdf) from qqi.ie
Aitheantas cáilíochtaí: is féidir ráiteas inchomparáideachta le haghaidh do cháilíocht agus treoir úsáideora (pdf) ó qqi.ie a íoslódáil
If you are seeking employment in Ireland, the job advertisement or recruitment agency will advise you how to apply for the job
Má tá tú ag lorg fostaíochta in Éirinn, cuirfidh an fógra poist nó gníomhaireacht earcaíochta comhairle ort maidir le conas iarratas a dhéanamh ar an bpost

If you are a non-EEA national you can find out more information about General Employment Permits and Critical Skills Employment Permits on the website of the Department of Jobs, Enterprise and Innovation

Murar náisiúnach de chuid LEE tú, is féidir leat tuilleadh eolais a fháil maidir le Ceadanna Fostaíochta Ginearálta agus Ceadanna Fostaíochta Scileanna Ríthábhactacha ar láithreán gréasáin den Roinn Post, Fiontar agus Nuálaíochta
If you need a visa you must apply online for an Irish visa
Má víosa de dhíth ort, caithfidh tú iarratas ar líne ar víosa a dhéanamh
Contact information for recruitment agencies in Ireland is available in the telephone directory or through an online search
Tá fáil ar eolas teagmhála d'áisíneachtaí earcaíochta in Éirinn san eolaí teileafóin nó trí chuardach ar líne
